title: Records of Middle East Broadcasting Center

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm looking for any record of any media type or communication that the CIA might be in possession of regarding the Middle East Broadcasting Center. The Middle East Broadcasting Center was founded in 1991 and was reorganized into the MBC Group in 2003. I would like any of those records from 1991 to 2003.

I'm also looking for any record that the CIA may be in possession of, of journalist/ reporter for the Middle East Broadcasting Center named Baker Atyani, also misspelled in many post 2001 articles as Bakr Atiani or Bakr Ariani. I'm looking on any records related this journalist between 1991 and 2015.

Additionally, I'm looking for any record that the CIA may be in possession of, of Washington Post reporter Pamela Constable between 2000-2001.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Kallas

title: Records related Middle East Broadcasting Center

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm looking for any record of any media type or communication that the State Department might be in possession of regarding the Middle East Broadcasting Center. The Middle East Broadcasting Center was founded in 1991 and was reorganized into the MBC Group in 2003.  I would like any of those records from 1991 to 2003.

I'm also looking for any record i.e video reports, newspaper articles, written discussion communications that the State Department may be in possession of, of journalist/ reporter  for the Middle East Broadcasting Center named Baker Atyani, also misspelled in many post 2001 articles as Bakr Atiani or Bakr Ariani. I'm looking on any records related this journalist between 1991 and 2015. 

Additionally,  I'm looking for any record that the State Department may be in possession of, of Washington Post reporter Pamela Constable between 2000-2001.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Kallas
